name: Ingested Poison
description: Poison that must be swallowed to take effect, typically delivered in food or drink
trigger: Swallowing an entire dose of ingested poison

application.requirement: Entire dose must be swallowed for full effect
application.partialDose: GM may decide partial dose has reduced effect (Advantage on save or half damage)

savingThrow.onSuccess: typically half damage or no effect

samplePoisons.name: Assassin's Blood
samplePoisons.effect: Poisoned condition for 24 hours. Half damage only on successful save

samplePoisons.name: Midnight Tears
samplePoisons.effect: No effect until midnight. Any effect ending Poisoned condition neutralizes this poison. At midnight: save for damage
samplePoisons.special: Can be neutralized before midnight by removing Poisoned condition

samplePoisons.name: Pale Tincture
samplePoisons.effect: Poisoned condition. Repeats save every 24 hours, taking 3 (1d6) damage on failure. Damage cannot be healed while Poisoned. After 7 successful saves, poison ends

samplePoisons.name: Torpor
samplePoisons.effect: Poisoned condition for 4d6 hours. Speed halved while Poisoned

samplePoisons.name: Truth Serum
samplePoisons.effect: Poisoned condition for 1 hour. Cannot knowingly communicate a lie while Poisoned

ongoing: Some ingested poisons have recurring effects requiring repeated saves

detection.method: Wisdom (Perception) to notice odd taste/smell, Intelligence (Investigation) or Intelligence (Nature) to identify poison before consumption

mitigation: Don't consume food or drink from untrusted sources
Have food taster test meals first
Use Detection spells (Detect Poison and Disease)
Have proficiency with Poisoner's Kit to identify poisons
Have Resistance or Immunity to Poison damage
Use Protection from Poison spell before consuming suspect food
Purify Food and Drink spell removes poison from consumables
For Midnight Tears: Remove Poisoned condition before midnight to neutralize
tacticalConsiderations: Popular choice for assassinations due to stealth
Can be mixed into food or drink without target knowing
Delayed poisons (Midnight Tears) allow poisoner to establish alibi
Torpor useful for slowing escaping targets
Most effective when target is unaware

srdReference.quote: A creature must swallow an entire dose of ingested poison to suffer its effects. The dose can be delivered in food or a liquid. You may decide that a partial dose has a reduced effect, such as allowing Advantage on the saving throw or dealing only half as much damage on a failed save.

examples: Truth Serum administered to captured spy
Midnight Tears in nobleman's evening meal (takes effect at midnight)
Torpor in guard's drink to slow pursuit
Assassin's Blood in ale at tavern
